# MTLFunctionStitchingAttributeAlwaysInline

**Class**

An attribute to specify that Metal needs to inline all of the function calls when generating the stitched function.

## Declaration

```swift
class MTLFunctionStitchingAttributeAlwaysInline
```

## Overview

To inline functions in a call graph, instantiate an instance of this class and assign it as an attribute on the [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLFunctionStitchingGraph].

## Related Documentation

- **attributes**: A list of attributes to configure how the Metal device object generates the new stitched function.

## Stitched function libraries

- **Customizing shaders using function pointers and stitching**: Define custom shader behavior at runtime by creating functions from existing ones and preferentially linking to others in a dynamic library.
- **MTLStitchedLibraryDescriptor**: A description of a new library of procedurally generated functions.
- **MTLFunctionStitchingGraph**: A description of a new stitched function.
- **MTLFunctionStitchingInputNode**: A call graph node that describes an input to the call graph.
- **MTLFunctionStitchingFunctionNode**: A call graph node that describes a function call and its inputs.
- **MTLFunctionStitchingNode**: A protocol to identify call graph nodes.
- **MTLFunctionStitchingAttribute**: A protocol to identify types that customize how the Metal compiler stitches a function together.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- MTLFunctionStitchingAttribute
- NSObjectProtocol
